derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  onwæcnan, from on 'on' + waken

entry.def: To awaken a feeling in a person means to cause them to start having this feeling.

example.ex: The aim of the cruise was to awaken an interest in and an understanding of foreign cultures.
example.tran: 此次巡游旨在唤起我们对外国文化的兴趣和理解。

entry.def: When you awaken to a fact or when someone awakens you to it, you become aware of it.

example.ex: The British never awaken to peril until it is almost too late.
example.tran: 英国人从来不懂得防患于未然。

example.ex: ...the picture of the Earth, so blue and fragile, that awakened a generation to the Earth's mortality.
example.tran: 照片上的地球，如此的忧郁而脆弱，唤起了一代人对地球生命的意识

entry.def: When you awaken, or when something or someone awakens you, you wake up.

example.ex: Unfortunately, Grandma always seems to awaken at awkward moments...
example.tran: 不幸的是，奶奶好像总是醒来的不是时候。

example.ex: He was snoring when Desmond awakened him.
example.tran: 德斯蒙德叫醒他的时候他还在打呼噜呢。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to become awake or conscious;

sentences.sentence: "He was roused by the drunken men in the street"
"She woke up to the sound of the alarm clock"
"They were awakened to the sad facts"

sentences.cn: 我被他们的叫喊声吵醒。

means.word_mean: (使)察觉到， 意识到， 醒悟到

sentences.en: People are gradually awakening to their rights.
sentences.cn: 人们正逐渐意识到自己的权利。

sentences.en: The public has been awakened to the full horror of the situation.
sentences.cn: 公众完全意识到了这一状况的可怕程度。
